item.title: Contact and CV
item.description: Contact information: Email: alastair.jamieson-lane@uni-oldenburg.de Office: W15-1-145 Mail address: Campus Wechloy, Gebäude W15 Carl-von-Ossietzky-Straße 9 - 11 26111 Oldenburg Germany Curriculum Vitae

item.title: Research
item.description: Current Research Currently, I am working with the University of Oldenburg and UMCG in Groningen, studying the evolution and spread of antibiotic resistance. My most recent projects are focused on studying how horizontal gene transfer effects evolutionary dynamics in microbes, and how knowledge of network structure (on a variety of scales) can be used to predict and control the spread of infections. Past Research Pattern Formation In the Min System Symmetry breaking and pattern formation are critical to the existence of complex life in the world around us, and have fascinated researchers for many years.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: For Students I am not currently teaching. Previously I have taught: Multivariate Calculus at University of British Columbia Derivative Calculus for Life Scientist at University of British Columbia Derivative Calculus for Physical Sciences and Engineering at University of British Columbia STAR course (University mathematics for highschool students) at University of Canterbury (NZ)
